gurmukhi: ਲੰ ਲਖਤ ਜੋਗ ॥ ਭੰ ਭ੍ਰਮਤ ਭੋਗ ॥ ਬੰ ਬਕਤ ਬੈਨ ॥ ਚੰ ਚਕਤ ਨੈਨ ॥੪੧੪॥
transliteration: Lan Lakhat Jog|| Bhan Bhramat Bhog|| Ban Bakat Bain|| Channdchakat Nain||414||
translation: Seeing these Yogis, the pleasures and sexual enjoyments were getting illusioned in wonder.414.

gurmukhi: ਤੰ ਤਜਤ ਅਤ੍ਰ ॥ ਛੰ ਛਕਤ ਛਤ੍ਰ ॥ ਪੰ ਪਰਤ ਪਾਨ ॥ ਭੰ ਭਰਤ ਭਾਨ ॥੪੧੫॥
transliteration: Tan Tajat Atra|| Chhan Chhakat Chhatra|| Pan Parat Paan|| Bhan Bharat Bhaan||415||
translation: Forsaking their arms, weapons and canopies, the people were falling at the feet of these sages.415.

gurmukhi: ਬੰ ਬਜਤ ਬਾਦ ॥ ਨੰ ਨਜਤ ਨਾਦ ॥ ਅੌ ੳੁਠਤ ਰਾਗ ॥ ੳੁਫਟਤ ਸੁਹਾਗ ॥੪੧੬॥
transliteration: Ban Bajat Baad|| Nan Najat Naad|| An Outhat Raag|| Ouphtat Suhaag||416||
translation: Th musical instruments were being played; there was the sound of thunderous music and the songs were being sung.416.

gurmukhi: ਛੰ ਛਕਤ ਸੂਰ ॥ ਭੰ ਭ੍ਰਮਤ ਹੂਰ ॥ ਰੰ ਰਿਝਤ ਚਿੱਤ ॥ ਤੰ ਤਜਤ ਬਿੱਤ ॥੪੧੭॥
transliteration: Chhan Chhakat Soor|| Bhan Bhramat Hoor|| Ran Rijhat Chitt|| Tan Tajat Bitt||417||
translation: The god Surya and the heavenly damsels leaving their self-restraint, were getting pleased with them.417.

gurmukhi: ਛੰ ਛਕਤ ਜੱਛ ॥ ਭੰ ਭ੍ਰਮਤ ਪੱਛ ॥ ਭੰ ਭਿਰਤ ਭੂਪ ॥ ਨਵ ਨਿਰਖ ਰੂਪ ॥੪੧੮॥
transliteration: Chha Chhhakat Jachchh|| Bhan Bhramat Pachchh|| Bhan Bhirat Bhoop|| Nav Nirakh Roop||418||
translation: Seeing hem the Yakshas and birds were getting pleased and there was a run amongst the kings for their sight.418.

gurmukhi: ਗਲਿਤੰ ਜੋਗੰ ॥ ਦਲਿਤੰ ਭੋਗੰ ॥ ਭਗਿਵੇ ਭੇਸੰ ॥ ਸੁਫਿਲੇ ਦੇਸੰ ॥੪੧੯॥
transliteration: Gaditan Jouang|| Dalitan Bhogadg|| Bhagive Bhesan|| Souphile Desan||419||
translation: These Yogis who had been immersed in Yoga and who had withdrawn from all enjoyments, had been wearing the ochre-colored clothes of various countries. 419.

gurmukhi: ਅੱਚਲ ਧਰਮੰ ॥ ਅੱਖਲ ਕਰਮੰ ॥ ਅੱਮਿਤ ਜੋਗੰ ॥ ਤੱਜਿਤ ਭੋਗੰ ॥੪੨੦॥
transliteration: Achchal Dharman|| Akkhal Karman|| Ammit Jouang|| Tajjit Bhogadg||420||
translation: These Yogis of firm conduct and sinless Karmas had abandoned all enjoyments.420.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਫਲ ਕਰਮੰ ॥ ਸੁਬ੍ਰਿਤ ਧਰਮੰ ॥ ਕੁਕ੍ਰਿਤ ਹੰਤਾ ॥ ਸੁਗਤੰ ਗੰਤਾ ॥੪੨੧॥
transliteration: Souphal Karman|| Soubrit Dharman|| Koukrit Hantaa|| Sougadan Gadtaa||421||
translation: These vow-observing Yogis of good conduct and sinless Karmas had given up all evil actions.421.

gurmukhi: ਦਲਿਤੰ ਦ੍ਰੋਹੰ ॥ ਮਲਿਤੰ ਮੋਹੰ ॥ ਸਲਿਤੰ ਸਾਰੰ ॥ ਸੁਕ੍ਰਿਤ ਚਾਰੰ ॥੪੨੨॥
transliteration: Dalitan Drohan|| Mallitan Mohan|| Salitan Saaran|| Soukrit Chaaran||422||
translation: These were the people who had destroyed attachment and deceit and performers of good actions like the waters of all the sacred rivers.422.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਵੇ ਭੇਸੰ ॥ ਸੁਫਲੰ ਦੇਸੰ ॥ ਸੁਹ੍ਰਿਦੰ ਸਰਤਾ ॥ ਕੁਕ੍ਰਿਤੰ ਹਰਤਾ ॥੪੨੩॥
transliteration: Bhagve Bhesan|| Souphalan Desan|| Suhridan Sartaa|| Koukritan Hartaa||423||
translation: They were kind-hearted people, wearing ochre-coloured clothes, purifying all the countries far and near were the destroyers of evil actions.423.

gurmukhi: ਚਕ੍ਰਿਤ ਸੂਰੰ ॥ ਬਮਤੰ ਨੂਰੰ ॥ ੲੇਕੰ ਜਪਿਤੰ ॥ ੲਿਕੰ ਥਪਿਤੰ ॥੪੨੪॥
transliteration: Chakrit Sooran|| Bamtan Nooran|| Ekan Japitan|| Ekan Thapitan||424||
translation: Seeing their radiance even the sun was wonder-struck; and someone out of them was repeating the Name of the Lord, and someone was singing the Praises of the Lord.4244.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜੰਤ ਸਿਤ੍ਵੰ ॥ ੲੀਸੰ ਭਜਿਤ੍ਵੰ ॥ ਜਪੰ ਜਪਿਤ੍ਵੰ ॥ ੲੇਕੰ ਥਪਿਤ੍ਵੰ ॥੪੨੫॥
transliteration: Raajant Sitvan|| Oosan Bhajitvan|| Japan Japitvan|| Ekan Thapitvan||425||
translation: While remembering and repeating the Name of the Lord, they were firmly establishing the Lord in their mind.425.

gurmukhi: ਬਜਤੰ ਨਾਦੰ ॥ ਬਿਦਿਤੰ ਰਾਗੰ ॥ ਜਪਤੰ ਜਾਪੰ ॥ ਤ੍ਰਸਿਤੰ ਤਾਪੰ ॥੪੨੬॥
transliteration: Bajttan Naadan|| Biditan Raagadg|| Japatan Japan|| Trasitan Taapan||426||
translation: The horns were being sounded and there was the singing of Ragas (musical modes); the Name of the Lord was being repeated, which had frightened the sins.426.
